review:

Fantastic device it's have 2 year onsite warranty that is really good

I received the Pixel 2 (Just Black - 64 GB) well on time and have been using
it for 2 weeks now.  
The phone speaks for itself and is already proven to be a top of the line
smartphone.  
  
But just to mention some pros and cons from my perspective:  
Pros  
\- The main USP of this phone is the pure Android experience which is so fluid
to use. It also remains up to date on the latest available version of Android.
The phone is always a breeze to use.  
\- Another USP of this phone is the great camera which gives you amazing
photos with high detail and dynamic range thanks to HDR+. Also stabilization
using OIS results in smooth videos and blur free photos.  
\- Now with the phone receiving Android Oreo 8.1 update, it has become even
better. Things like AR stickers are so much fun to use. The Pixel Visual Core
SoC has also been enabled, allowing third party apps to use HDR+ for
processing photos. The Visual Core also adds more machine learning
capabilities to keep making the phone smarter day by day.  
\- Unlimited storage for photos (at least till 2020)  
\- Rich sounding front facing stereo speakers for which one can pardon the big
bezels  
\- Waterproof with IP67 rating (good enough for splashes and dunks up to 1
meter depth for 30 minutes)  
\- One handed use  
\- Fast charging using the provided power adapter  
\- 2 years warranty  
  
Cons  
\- Big bezels which is already outdated on most flagships  
\- No headphone jack. USB C to 3.5 mm adapter is provided but carrying it
around everywhere is not always feasible  
\- Though you get unlimited online storage for Photos and Videos, the internal
storage is limited to 64 GB or 128 GB based on which you buy. So you can't
store tons of WhatsApp media and other such data. Long term users should
probably go for the 128 GB version. An expandable storage would have been
nice.  
  
Apart from the above pros and cons, here are few other mentions:  
\- The overall design is good especially the back which has a dual finish  
\- The buttons including the fingerprint scanner are tactile and intuitively
placed. The fingerprint scanner is fast to unlock.  
\- The battery is good for a full day of medium use  
\- Always on display is a nice touch and is useful to see the time and any
notifications by just lifting the phone or double tapping it.  
\- Active edge squeeze is a nice fancy addition to launch Google Assistant but
not something you would use much. Its currently useful when you need to launch
Assistant half a second faster than long pressing the on screen Home button.
It would be more useful if it can be programmed to launch other apps or snap
photos or change the sound profile. You get the gist.  
To sum it up, the Pixel 2 is a great flagship all rounder which functions the
way a smartphone was meant to and comes with some class leading features
backed by a great brand.  
With more budget the Pixel 2 XL is probably the better phone to own. But who's
complaining :)

Google is back with the second-generation of Pixel smartphones. Google pixel 2
and Google pixel 2 XL are the latest offerings from google. Except the screen
size, bezels and XL's pOLED display and higher price, rest everything is
similar in both the phones  
  
Edit >> The new Google Pixel 2 has bumped the iPhone 8 Plus and Galaxy Note 8
off the number one spot to become the top performing smartphone camera in
mobile photography tests.  
  
Major Pros >> 👍  
  
Pure and latest android software for the next three years  
Clean interface  
The best camera  
User friendly  
Power efficient internals  
Good battery life and fast recharging  
  
Major cons >> 👎  
  
Big bezels in 2017  
5 inch Small screen.  
As nearly borderless screens become common on flagship smartphones, the Pixel
2’s thick frames make the phone look outdated.  
No 3.5 mm headphone jack ( but headphone adapter is included)  
No expandable storage - There’s no microSD card slot.  
No facial recognition or iris scanning  
Expensive  
  
Now let's get on to the review in detail  
  
Design >>  
It has a likeable design and divisive two-tone glass and metal rear .  
The circular fingerprint reader is on the back, along with a solitary USB
Type-C port on the bottom for charging. On the left-hand edge sits both the
power button and volume rocker.  
  
Display >>  
  
It has a 5-inch, 1920 X 1080 pixel AMOLED display with bezels  
Standard 16:9 aspect ratio.  
You can choose from either “standard” or “vibrant” display profiles in the
phone’s settings. The former produces more accurate-looking colours, while the
latter has a tendency to oversaturate colours – but not by much.  
It is reasonably readable in sunlight but for very bright conditions some
screen shading is required.  
Movies and photos have a pop and vibrancy in colours.  
  
Performance >>  
The latest Snapdragon 835 processor teams up with 4GB of RAM and a choice of
either 64GB or 128GB of storage to give a Superlative performance >> smooth,
lightning fast and snappy.  
  
Its graphics performance is more than good enough to handle anything you can
download from Google Play.  
  
Software and Features >>  
  
You get user friendly, top notch latest Android (Oreo 8.0.1) experience  
  
There is a option to go for 64 GB or 128 GB in this variant .  
  
Active edge feature rocks >> Just squeeze the phone to silence an incoming
call or as a shortcut to launch google assistant  
  
Always-on display >> Convenient feature that shows the date, time and
notification icon even when the phone sleeps  
  
The coolest display feature is Now Playing , which can identify any music
playing in the surroundings.  
  
Regular updates will keep you ahead always :)  
  
Can upload unlimited photos and videos till 2020  
  
It will get the upcoming Android P and Q and R updates before any other phone.  
  
Picture in picture mode >> is a feature focused on multitasking that lets you
keep one app, for example YouTube, in a small floating window while checking
your email or Google maps full-screen.  
  
Smart Text Select >> This automatically recognises items such as phone
numbers, place names and addresses, making it easier to select what you need
quickly with a single tap and makes cut and paste much easier.  
  
Google Pixel 2 owners also get an exclusive bonus feature called Google Lens
>> that turns your camera into a realtime object-identification tool. Just tap
the Lens icon when looking at a photo, and Google will identify the subject
and provide useful information. For example, Google was able not only to
identify my pet as a dog , but also got the breed right !  
  
Camera >>  
  
* Rear: 12.2-megapixel, f/1.8, OIS, phase detection & laser autofocus, dual-LED flash  
* Front: 8-megapixel, f/2.4  
  
It has both optical and electronic image stabilisation for seriously stable
shots.  
  
The best ever ever to give you stunning pictures with superb dynamic range and
colour saturation . Gives better results than the dual lens camera of
competitors.  
  
It has set a new benchmark in smartphone photography.  
  
It has fancy new features, like the ability to capture a few seconds of
footage around a still photo to create images that move.  
  
There is Portrait mode in front facing camera also apart from rear camera.  
  
You get stunning details in all lighting conditions.  
  
If you like to post regularly on lnstagram then this is one handy weapon to
get wow pics.  
  
Videos >> 4K shooting is crisp and with fine details, but the Pixel 2 suffers
from some very super saturated colours  
  
IP 67 certification >>  
  
It is completely protected from dust and dirt and if you accidentally drop it
into the bath tub while texting, no worries, it would survive the soak up. In
fact it can survive in up to 1 meter deep water for 30 minutes.  
  
Battery life >>  
  
The 2700 mAh battery is small but super efficient and it will last you a day
between moderate to heavy usage plus fast charging will refill the juice in an
hour and twenty minutes.  
  
Dual Front facing speakers emit loud and clear sound and the bass is
sufficient as well.That's rare and what I call functionality over fashion.
Most phones have a mono at the bottom with sound quality compromised  
  
Connectivity options >>  
  
It includes an E-SIM and a single nano-SIM slot that lets you latch on to 4G
LTE radios. Then there’s the usual flagship options like Dual-Band Wi-Fi
802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, Bluetooth v5.0 with LE, NFC, GPS and USB 2.0 Type-C port
with a reversible connector.  
  
Comes with 2 year warranty  
  
Closest competitors >>  
  
You have the iPhone 8, which has a 4.7 in screen and costs Rs 58,880 ( when
writing the review) the Sony Xperia XZ premium with a 5.5 in display for Rs
55949, the Samsung Galaxy S8's screen is larger at 5.8 in, at Rs 58880,
currently.  
  
WHO SHOULD BUY THIS  
  
If you are an android fan and appreciate clean software and great camera above
everything else.  
If you value functionality over fashion and substance over style  
If you want a phone that's smart, fast and compact .  
If you care for the pure and latest android  
If you want an AI buddy ( Google Assistant) to answer your queries and plan
your day with just a squeeze  
  
Then what's a bit of bezel to come in the way of your picking this gem?  
  
AND WHY SHOULD YOU AVOID PIXEL 2 XL ?  
  
The 6 inch big brother has many issues like burn in , muted colours, greenish
tinge on the poled screen..... etc cropping up ever since it was launched.  
The pixel 2 has had minimal issues which get fixed with software updates and
compared to the big brother it only has two minuses - small size and battery.  
  
VERDICT  
  
Google pixel 2 has a lot many things going for it but it's bezels and a bit
smaller screen seem to have overshadowed all the goodness.  
With the price dropping ( It was launched with price tag of 61000 for the 64
GB variant) , If you buy it, you won't regret it at all.  
  
Hope this is helpful to you :)

This is an awesome device.. no app crashes unlike other Android devices.. the
main reason I switched to iPhone few years back was Android lags.. but this
one is perfect .. came with it's portrait feature is ultra cool.. OS fluidity
is good.. being able to shoot unlimited photos and videos is cool but is

Years.. but for now this mobile is really good.. I got it for 51k in an
special offer .. for 61k I think it's a bit too much

Best phone I have ever used. Top class camera quality. I would say better than
iPhone's all series so far.

Bought this handset on dec 25th. Initially worked great for a week, now not
receiving any incoming calls. Sim working fine with other handsets, but not on
this one. Tried with other SIM cards, unable to receive calls. Din’t expect
this from a google phone after paying 50k.

Buy it for the unparalleled camera, Machine-learning and AI assisted
experience, and pure android experience

I got this one over the XL because of the small form factor and the fact that
it's been made by HTC. The camera is simply awesome. Battery lasts me over a
day. But my usage is not too heavy. Charging takes about an hour from 10% to
full! Screen looks good too. Performance is fluid. Google assistant works
flawlessly; much better than Siri (was a loyal Apple customer; but 92,000 for
the X forced me to look for options). Have ordered a Spigen thin cover for
this one since I don't want it to get too bulky. Love the stock android -
clean and fast.  
  
Speakers are not that loud even though they're front-facing. iPhone 8 is much
better in terms of loudness. Sometimes I miss message notifications coz
they're too soft (even with volume turned up to full).

Note:- Your Smart Buyer if your Reading this Review before buying Pixel 2.
Always read Reviews before buying anything Online. If your planing to buy
Pixel 2 , then do read my Review. Rather making a long review , i made it
short , i mentioned major Pros and Cons of Pixel 2. I Hope my Review Helps.  
  
●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●  
  
Google's first Pixel smartphonesweren't just smartphones; they were a
proclamation that Google was more than just a software giant. They were proof
that it could craft first-class devices that showed off what Android was
really capable of. The new Pixel 2 and 2 XL continue that new tradition and
offer some major changes to the Pixel formula. They're also among the first
devices to highlight what's new and notable in Android 8.0 Oreo. While they
don't get absolutely everything right, Google's new phones have still managed
to further the Pixel's reputation for Android excellence.  
  
⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟  
Below are the major Pros and Cons of Pixel 2  
⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟⍟  
⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️  
  
✔️✔️✔️✔️✔️✔️✔️✔️✔️  
Pros/Likable/Advantages  
✔️✔️✔️✔️✔️✔️✔️✔️✔️  
  
🏅Includes the latest Android stock operating system – Android Oreo.  
  
🏅Charging is USB Type-C with support for quick charging.  
  
🏅There is a finger print sensor, unlike Apple’s iPhone X.  
  
🏅It is water resistant up to IP68.  
  
🏅Highest rated smartphone camera (on the rear).  
  
🏅Squeezable frame to open Google Assistant.  
  
🏅Entry model has 64GB of storage.  
  
🏅Specs inside are the latest, with a Qualcomm Snapdragon 835 and a Adreno 540
GPU.  
  
🏅It has a 5.6 inch full HD display.  
  
🏅A large 3,220 mAh battery, along with optimized software, for a long battery
life.  
  
🏅Amazing performance.  
  
🏅No camera bump on the rear.  
  
🏅A great quality premium-feeling phone.  
  
🏅Operating system updates always come to Pixel phones first.  
  
🏅4GB of RAM.  
  
❌❌❌❌❌❌❌❌❌❌❌  
Cons/Unlikable/Disadvantages  
❌❌❌❌❌❌❌❌❌❌❌  
  
👎A very ‘2016’ design for a smartphone.  
  
👎No wireless charging, unlike the new iPhones and Samsungs.  
  
👎The front chins are still incredibly large, even for 2015/6!  
  
👎Quite expensive.  
  
👎The finger print sensor, being on the back, may annoy some users.  
  
👎There is no option to expand storage.  
  
👎There is no headphone jack (which is ironic considering Google made a big
deal out of keeping the headphone jack on the original Pixel last year)!  
  
👎Single SIM, unlike the likes of the OnePlus 5.  
  
👎There are still side-bezels around the screen, unlike most of 2017’s
smartphones.  
  
➕➖➕➖  
Final Words  
➕➖➕➖  
  
The main USP to Google smartphones comes with the operating system, where the
consumer can expect to always have the latest and greatest software from
Google, with it always being stock Android. For many, this is enough to buy
the newest Pixel every year.  
  
However, Google ditched the Nexus line up, which targeted mid-range
smartphones, and opted for the high-end premium segment to target the likes of
Apple and Samsung. The problem is that, to do this, the smartphones they
release need to also have the designs that compete against Apple and Samsung.  
  
Yes, the Pixel 2 is squeezable. However, the front chin on the Pixel 2 is
almost criminal to have in 2017. Will people still buy it? Yes. But, I can
imagine more people would rather pay a little more for the Pixel 2 XL ‘2017’
design than the Pixel 2.  
  
Ultimately, forgetting the design, the Pixel 2 is a brilliant smartphone. The
camera is the best ever on a smartphone. If you can get over the bezels on the
front of the phone, then Google might be onto another winner of a smartphone.  
  
●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●●  
  
If you have any Doubt regarding this Review or this Product, then Feel Free to
Contact me or Comment Below. Thank You for Reading this Review. I Hope my
Review was Helpful.  
  
➽Regards,  
➽Keerthi Kanth.

review:
People will say it's got bezels.. it has screen issues, It has no headphone
jack!  
But what they don't get it's that! It's the best ANDROID PHONE Till date and
it's camera is the highest rated ever, not to forget the squeeze functionality
to launch Google assistant. Google is a software inherited company and is
doing as promised and expected by it! Best phone indeed

Warning! These are just first impressions on day two.  
  
I particularly dislike spending an obscene amount of money on a phone. But
after getting thoroughly frustrated using the Redmi note 3 (bad camera), and
the Motorola G4 plus (great camera that stutters and kills the battery, 'ghost
touch' and a ton of repairs in the first four months itself) I decided to
spend hard earned money to take refuge in the Google ecosystem that I love. I
took a leap of faith and bought it online without holding one in hand at a
showroom.  
  
As expected, the camera performance is great and the phone is quick. The
stereo speakers at the front are very powerful. I am still exploring the phone
but I must say that first impression is good. That I can upload an unlimited
amount of photo and videos from its exceptional camera at full resolution to
Google photos till 2020 is what tilted the balance in favor of this phone from
the I-phone 8 plus which is a worthy competitor. This phone is sleeker
compared to pixel XL and does not have screen issues that seem to plague the
XL.  
  
I wish the fingerprint scanner was on the front though.
